item.description:
A walk that takes you along 3 beaches from the Red Rock Bistro in Swampscott to the "Tides" Restaurant in Nahant. This will be a relaxing hike at the shore and a nice sea breeze can be awfully refreshing on a hot summer day. Plan to bring a lunch or buy one at the well known "Tides" once we get to Nahant as we will stop for some lunch out on the beach before turning around to head back.
Trip Coordinator: Naomi at naomi.allen07@gmail.com or (617) 277-9968 (til 9:45 pm) cell day of trip 857-540-6458
RSVP: Required by August 7th to Naomi at her address above. Please include a cell number for contact on the 8th.
MEET: at Red Rock Bistro, 141 Humphrey Street, in Swampscott at 11:00 am. http://www.redrockbis...
COST: Bring money for lunch or beverage/food or ice cream afterwards, plus $5 for the event which can be credited towards a membership if you join Mosaic of Ma later this year.
PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: Commuter Rail to the Swampscott is the quickest ride from Boston and the 10:15 train out of North Station arrives at 10:37. The Red Rock Bistro is only 6/10 mile walk from the Swampscott station on Burrill Street. (when you get off the train take a right onto Burrill st and follow it down to the water and the Red Rock Bistro is right there).Buses: the 442 buses from Wonderland to Humphrey and Redington Street (1 stop after Monument Ave)is across the street from the Red Rock Bistro. The 441-bus
stop is at the corner of Paradise road and Burrill Street 3/10 of a mile away.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Beach Walk to Nahant
